conclusion: Four identical wooden blocks are on a smooth horizontal surface, blocks B and C are connected by a spring, and a force F is applied to block B.

Four identical blocks have the same mass m, blocks B and C are connected by a light spring, a horizontal force F is applied to block B, all blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration a, the surface is smooth, and we need to find the static friction force on block D.
Blocks C and D must remain in contact to have the same acceleration, similarly for blocks A and B.
Equation of motion for block B: F - F_spring = m路a.
Equation of motion for block C: F_spring - F_frictionDC = m路a.
Equation of motion for block D: F_frictionDC = m路a.
Equation of motion for block A: F_contactBA = m路a.
Static friction force on block D: F_frictionDC = F/4.
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process is F/4.
